admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
subsc: Agricultural extension and research,Power,Forestry,Animal production,Irrigation and drainage

abstracts.cdata!:
The Tarim Basin Project will alleviate
            poverty in several of the poorest counties with a
            predominant minority population in Xinjiang Region by
            increasing crop and livestock production and productivity.
            The project will: (i) rehabilitate and upgrade irrigation
            and drainage facilities in Yerqiang and Weigan oases through
            construction of canal lining, drainage canals, diversion
            structures, tubewells and onfarm works for low yielding land
            and reclaimed areas of desert wasteland; (ii) construct a
            small hydro-power station on the Yerqiang River and
            inter-connecting transmission grid to expand the electrical
            generating and transmission capacities; (iii) finance the
            improvement and expansion of the agricultural extension
            system at county and township levels; seed processing,
            distribution and multiplication systems; farm mechanization
            centers; hail suppression system, and research in cotton;
            (iv) finance the expansion of livestock services in breed
            improvement, veterinary and feed development services,
            improved research and training and development of mixed
            crop/livestock farms; and (v) finance an ecosystem
            restoration component designed to recover some of the
            natural forest along the Tarim River which boarders the
            Taklimakan desert to prevent expansion of the desert.
